data.title: Upgrade Starling Maven Flexmojos Build to work with Apache Flex
data.body:
Hi,

I've upgraded starling framework maven build to work with flexmojos 6.0.1 that supports Adobe Flex and Apache Flex SDKs.

I upgraded as well to playerglobal 11.7 since there's code dependencies in this Flash Player 11.7

As a side upgrade, i'm working with IntelliJ IDEA and added .idea config files to .gitignore to avoid any control version for this kind of files.

Final comment and implications of this patch: I succeed building Starling Framework with Flexmojos 6.0.1 and Apache Flex SDK 4.9.1.1447119 inside IntelliJ IDEA 13 latest EAP (this will not work in current 12.1.4 release since it needs a fix to get flexmojos working with "org.apache" namespace instead "com.adobe")

data.title: Minor code consistency change in Texture.fromColor using onRestore
data.body:
This is minor, but just to be consistent with all other Texture.from\* functions,
shouldn't the onRestore function in Texture.fromColor only be created and set
if (Starling.handleLostContext)) returns true? This seems to wrap all other uses of onRestore setups.

data.title: AssetManager doesn't support json array encoding.
data.body:
AssetManger checks for the first character of a string for '{' to determin whether or not it is JSON encoded string, however a json encoded array begins with a '['.

Example:

["test1","test2"]

is valid JSON

data.title: Fix regression from ccfc734.
data.body:
The commit that added the optimize for render parameter to Texture.empty() put a new boolean next to
an existing boolean argument, and when that new parameter was added to RenderTexture's usage, it was
put in the wrong location, flipping the correct values for mipmapping and optmize for render.

data.title: Support BGRA_PACKED texture format
data.body: It would be useful if there was an option to set textures to use the [`Context3DTextureFormat.BGRA_PACKED`](http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display3D/Context3DTextureFormat.html#BGRA_PACKED) texture format which can be quite useful for reducing GPU memory usage for some graphics. I know this was just added in FP 11.7 so don't know the implications to Starling's compatibility with older FP versions if it was added though. Overall, seemed like a pretty feasible feature to support from my quick glance over of the relevant code.

data.title: Bug in DisplayObjectContainer.as
Include units more often in Juggler.as ASDoc
data.body:
Found a few more places where units might be helpful in the doc

Changes:
Added units to delayCall, tween, and elapsedTime functions of Juggler

data.title: Starling keyboard events can be cancelled, which then cancels native keyboard events
data.body:
Native KeyboardEvents are cancellable with preventDefault(). This is essential for certain keyCodes like Keyboard.BACK where you need to call preventDefault() to keep Android from handling the back button and leaving your app.

Starling should expose this ability to cancel keyboard events. If, after broadcastEvent() returns, the new function isDefaultPrevented() returns true, preventDefault() can be called on the native event.

data.title: Include units more often in Tween.as ASDoc
data.body: The ASDoc for Tween.as mentions that the times are in seconds in a few places but probably not in others where it would be helpful. Although users could probably guess that it's in seconds, some tween engines use frames or other units, so this should help clear things up just a little in a few cases.

data.title: Filters not using RectangleTexture
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

again a RectangleTexture thingy. Filters are always using POT textures. I changed that in my project, not a big deal. But I found that filters reading textures with another texture repeat option than "clamp" will not show up at all. I guess that might be more a AGAL issue rather than a starling issue? Is this a known AGAL restriction using RectangleTexture or even common GPU knowledge that I missed?

Thanks in advance

Michael

data.title: Error #3677: Texture decoding failed. Internal error.
data.body:
Hi Everyone,
I am nob in starling and I follow this tutorial http://treefortress.com/tutorial-compressed-textures-in-air-atf-format/ about ATF file format to compress the assets, but every time that I compile Flash Builder 4.7 give me the error 3677, I have the -swf-version=17  parameters, and I already try all formats of ATF. The project it is here
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/b0cxpqk87x187zn/SukGrshwxV

data.title: Stats display shows corrupted text
data.body:
This is a bit of a weird one... For some reason, Starling's stat's display box shows up corrupted. It looks as if the stats are rendered without actually removing the previous value/texture that was shown, so the end result is unreadable.
This only happens on one device (Sony Xperia S), never seen this happen on my desktop or any ios device. I'm also getting really poor performance from this phone and I thought maybe this could be a symptom of wider problem. I've also tried changing the stats display class to use a larger font size but the problem remains.
Any idea what could cause such an issue?

data.title: Problem creating an instance of a TextField
data.body:
I just got the latest version of Starling-Framework from master (https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/archive/master.zip). After that I get an error when creating an instance of a TextField:

ReferenceError: Error #1065: Variable flash.display3D::Context3DProfile is not defined.
    at starling.textures::Texture$/empty()[c:\temp\src\starling\textures\Texture.as:306]
...

Everything else seems to work just fine, I can add sprites and movieclips to the scene without any issues.

I realise this may not be a Starling-Framework issue and I apologize in advance if that's the case. But I didn't get this issue prior to updating to the latest version from github.

More info:
I'm using Apache Flex 4.9.1

data.title: New ATF Format error while using starling.swc
data.body:
Hi, thank you for supporting new ATF format.
I downloaded latest version of Starling and when I try to use new ATF format in my project and compile using swc it throws "Invalid ATF format" exception, but when I compile using source code it runs without any problems.

data.title: BUG in VertexData.getBounds
added build and config files for Meez from dev branch
invaild Context3D bounds error in FireFox when resize
Tween performance improvement
data.body:
Using Scout CC's mem profile you can see that Tween.advanceTime is creating memory very often. http://d.pr/i/REXv

The culprit, head-smackingly, is the isNaN() call, which creates a MethodClosure for some reason.

JacksonDunstan has an alternative NaN check which is (val != val) because any comparison with NaN is false, even NaN == NaN.  If you use this check instead Tween.advanceTime will stop allocating MethodClosures completely.

``` javascript
if (mStartValues[i] != mStartValues[i]) //isNaN check
    mStartValues[i] = mTarget[mProperties[i]] as Number;
```

data.title: starling.textures.Texture.empty() not supporting RectangleTexture
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

I'm not sure whether this is intended, but I found that ...

starling.textures.Texture.empty(width, height);

... is always creating a regular POT Texture even though RectangleTexture is supported.
I'm using a workaround for now, but Is there another way to create a RectangleTexure without a BitmapData (e.g. for use with a ByteArray)?

Kind regards

Michael

data.title: DisplayObjectContainer: return from setChildIndex() if index is the same
data.body: Avoids two calls to splice(). Since splice() creates two arrays (the rest argument and the return), this should help avoid some garbage collection.

data.title: Maven pom.xml update
data.body: Updated Maven's pom.xml to update build dependencies, fix current version numbering and switch to FlexMojos 6.

data.title: FragmentFilter error with ipad 3/4 when  scale is 2
FragmentFilter bug with ipad 3/4 when set scale to 2
Feature request - userData property in DisplayObject
data.body: Would be nice to have this property. It could be useful for storing different stuff like sortingY for a custom sort or whatever you want without inheritance :)

data.title: Feature request - enableMouseChildren on Sprite
data.body: Would be nice to be able to set a simple Boolean enableMouseChildren to false on Starling Sprite, kinda like it works with standard Flash.

data.title: Add a hasGlyphs(str:String):Boolean to Starling's BitmapFont
data.body:
This is a minor feature request to add a function on BitmapFont which is analogous to AS3's Font class's public function hasGlyphs(str:String):Boolean

Just a public function that iterates each char in the text string and confirms all chars exist in the BitmapFont.

I could imagine if someone was using the BitmapFont and maybe could only support a limited Latin character set, but wanted to possibly cleanly fallback to using a device font when international support.

Currently BitmapFont just makes a trace() call and just drops missing characters.

One can easily write this as an external utility function themselves but might be nice to have as an official public function on the class.

data.title: A manual way to Handle Lost Context
Fix textBounds for empty TextFields
data.body:
Currently, empty TextFields with composed contents report nonsense
bounds. This commit initializes an empty TextField's bounds to
0, 0, 0, 0.

(The proper fix may be to change VertexData.getBounds() to return a 
zeroed-out Rectangle when numVertices==0, but I wasn't sure if that
would cause problems elsewhere.)

data.title: Update AssetManager.as
data.body:
Hi, 

I have two suggestions for the AssetManager:
1. When loading multiple texture atlases, processing the xml part takes quite some time (specially with extensive xmls). I suggest to process the xmls one by one with a short timeout to give the frame rate a break (as when loading raw assets, cmp. function processNext). 
2. The onProgress callback is invoked as soon as the texture is loaded/added. But xmls are not processed at this point. As mentioned before, this can take quite a bit of time. I added a second parameter to the callback to indicate whether xmls are processed yet. 

What do you think?

data.title: added reverse playback and "bounce" looping (back and forth)
data.body:
added functionality to `MovieClip` to allow reverse playback and "bounce" loop -- play forward and backward as a loop.

both are fully compatible with `MovieClip`'s existing features. setting `bounceLoop = true` will set `loop = false` and setting `loop = true` will set `bounceLoop = false`, since the two cannot both be true at once.  `reverse` works whether or not `loop` or `bounceLoop` are set.

there are two commits in this pull request because i implemented these changes against an out-of-date version of `MovieClip` and had to go back and reimplement them against the latest version.  better to look at the MovieClip.as diff than to look through the individual commits.

i haven't tested with your unit tests as i don't have that test suite set up, but i manually tested all the permutations of `loop`, `bounceLoop`, `reverse`, and an `Event.COMPLETE` handler that i could come up with, and have been running with this code successfully for a couple of months now.
